manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why is Eucalan no-rinse? The formula doesn't require that it be rinsed. With your first soak in Eucalan, you should likely see the water in the wash basin turn a bit brown. The soap releases dirt into the wash basin, & though the clothing absorbs a little of the soap, it is beneficial. Lanolin fortifies & conditions clothing fibres - particularly great for woolens & knits, but can be used on most anything. Scented with only pure essential oils, some of them contain long-term cleaning properties that are intended to remain in the clothing to further benefit from; Think swim suits & lingerie that lie close to the skin, or blankets & knitted sweaters that get packed away for the cold months. Eucalan’s no-rinse formula is also convenient – great for travel when you’re not likely to have a washing machine, or are seeking to conserve water. If you still feel the urge to rinse, it is safe to do so. The soap has done its job of cleaning, though you will lose the lasting effects of the lanolin & essential oils.

Unscented Eucalan’s Unscented Delicate Wash is the same trusted formula without essential oils. It is Eucalan – bare naked, with no added chemicals to hide the natural scent of the product. It is our suggested wash for those with scent sensitivities.

Unscented Delicate Wash Eucalan's Most Popular Wash For those with scent sensitivities, use Eucalan Unscented on all your delicates such as sweaters, lingerie, hosiery, comforters, down jackets, bathing suits and baby items. Really, it is great anytime you don’t want a competing scent. Does one scent clean better than the other? Each scent of Eucalan launders the same, releasing dirt from the item and into the water. However, certain essential oils have different lasting benefits. Grapefruit and Lavender have unique cleaning characteristics. Lavender and Eucalyptus have properties best used on woolens and items that get stored away periodically. Our Favourite Items to Wash in Eucalan's Unscented Baby Clothing & Toys Bedding Lingerie Sportswear Makeup Brushes Pets & Their Bedding

Baby Toys & Clothing Eucalan is a delicately mild soap, gentle enough to be the primary detergent used to care for all your babies’ favourite things. Eucalan is safe to use on baby clothing, stuffed animals, wool diaper covers, blankies, sheepskins, and even nursing bras. Eucalan's Lavender is our favourite wash for all things baby related because of its soothing and relaxing properties. Pets & Their Bedding Pets benefit from being washed in non-toxic Eucalan. The lanolin helps to condition their skin and hair/fur. Cats, dogs, guinea pigs, hedgehogs, horses, and more are safe to wash with Eucalan. Safe to use on their bedding as well. Household Items Eucalan is safe on all types of delicate hairs and fibres. The simple formula makes household cleaning a breeze. Use Eucalan for cleaning make up brushes, upholstery, carpets, curtains, and more.

.17 oz (5mL) Pod 3.3 oz (100mL) Bottle 16.9 oz (500mL) Bottle 1 gal (4L) Jug Washes per Bottle 1-2 uses 20 hand washes 95 hand washes or 33 machine washes 760 hand washes or 253 machine washes Best for Travel, stocking stuffers, or to try out. Extended travel, paired with a hand knit gift, or expensive garment. Occasional home use or select favourite pieces. Frequent home use or refilling smaller portable bottles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best wool wash I’ve found!
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is wonderful!! Cleans well, is very gentle, and has zero fragrance. I’m very sensitive to chemicals, so its extremely important that anything I use chemical free and unscented. This is perfect. It’s great for wool, but is also great on cotton, as the lanolin softens the cotton. The only downside is it’s a little on the expensive side, but you if you actually use the amount they suggest it does go a long way. I just seem to have trouble doing that!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I almost gave up on wearing silk... BUT--
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is awesome. It restores a lovely sheen to silk fabrics when they're washed. It doesn't require excessive agitation to cleanse the fabric, and rinsing the fabrics in fresh water is not necessary when you're ready to hang dry them (in fact, the instructions specifically say NOT to rinse the fabrics), so laundering with this formula is about as easy as handwashing gets. Definitely going to purchase again when my current bottle runs out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is fantastic for all laundry
reviews.reviewText: I was absolutely blown away at how good this fabric wash is ... and that it does not have to be rinsed!I actually found this when checking on a brand of sheets I found in a thrift shop in Jacksonville ... SDH. Wonderful sheets ... and guessing from the price of them here at Amazon I now understand why. OMG, $150 for one standard pillow case!Anyway, on the page with the sheets there was this Eucalan wash ... so I looked at it. Compared to the LeBlanc, it was a little less expensive ... and as I read the reviews I really got excited. You can use this in the washer, but you don't rinse it ... you go right to spin after you've let it soak for 1/2 hr or more. I ordered it and washed the expensive SDH sheets in it ... and they came out looking great and feeling wonderful.Decided to do all my laundry in it. Just spent the last weekend doing my clothing. OMG, does it make your clothing feel great! And the bonus for me, I just started full-timing in a RV morothome with my own laundry ... this means I use less water and don't have to full hookups when doing the laundry (so long as I don't go overboard ;-) )

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2017
reviews.reviewText: I've always been a fan of the Kokaburra lanolin wash that I used to buy at our local food co-op. After we moved to a different state I wasn't able to find it so I decided to buy this one based on the great reviews (it was cheaper online than the Kokaburra). I used it to wash a sheepskin that had gotten very dirty and dusty during our move. And it now looks so white and beautiful and soft! I'm very impressed! A little bit of product is enough. It lathers very well. The smell is almost non existent, which I'm happy about. I can't wait to use it to wash all my knitted sweaters & scarves this Winter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love the wash for my Irish Sweaters
reviews.reviewText: I tried it on my Irish sweater, works well. No rinse. Though I might rinse next time. I feel like my sweater stretched a bit doesn't feel as bulky as it did when I first got it. I am a traveler living in an Airstream so something easy to use is key. I have to say, it was easy to wash, drying time was 2-3 days of air drying. Would try the scented next time. I would highly recommend this wash.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Product, not just for wool!!!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this originally for washing wool diaper covers but I have started using this on blankets because it makes them SO SOFT. I had the unfortunate experience of not reading the instructions on how to dry a very plush microfiber blanket and it came out of the dryer a little rough. Knowing what this does with wool, I tried it on the blanket and it was almost back to its normal fluffiness... gave it a second wash with a soak and fwala, super plush blanket is super soft again, just like new.Lanolin is amazing and this laundry soap is a game changer when it comes to having very soft fabric.The only negative thing I could even say is that it's incredibly unfortunate that lanolin is a common contact allergen, so if you have Eczema, you may want to avoid this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2018
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is amazing! I used it to clean two IKEA sheepskins that were matted and grubby. I put them in our high-efficiency washer and hung them to dry on a rack. At first, they looked sad, but once they dried after a couple days, I brushed them out with my dog's clean wire brush... and they look just as good as new! I also washed an alpaca skin rug that I got in Ecuador a decade ago. It was filthy and matted. I washed it in the tub and gently squeezed out the suds (didn't rinse). It hung to dry for several days, and looked very sad, to the point where I thought I'd ruined it. But then once I brushed it out and put some leather conditioner on the back, it was gorgeous once again! Also, I love that there is an unscented version! Highly, highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wish I'd Known About This Product Sooner
reviews.reviewText: I rarely write reviews but I had to write this one. I've recently started buying cashmere and merino wool sweaters at consignment shops. Not entirely trusting that the sweaters had been cleaned I decided to clean them before adding them to my wardrobe. But dry cleaning more than a dozen sweaters is prohibitively expensive.I used to use the famous W-------- to clean my sweaters and other delucates. Nothing wrong with that product but it uses a tremendous amount of water to wash one sweater (soak, rinse at least once, fabric softener, if used) and I live in a state where water is in short supply. Somewhere I stumbled across a mention of this product and decided to try it.I've now washed a dozen or so sweaters and love this product. One short soak and you are done. I purchase the unscented version and it is unscented. It is pricy but a little goes a long way.Color may bleed when you wash things so, if you wash multiple items at a time, make sure they are similar shades! I wash my sweaters individually but noticed some discoloration in the water as I emptied the basin.
I have alpaca and 100% wool items which I washed by hand. Pretty easy to use.
Lavage des lainages tout en douceur. Plus besoin de rincer et la laine après séchage est gonflée et très douce. Je recommande. Perso j’ai utilisé le savon neutre car je n’aime pas le parfum.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I was so pleased to buy this large bottle of this great liquid. I crochet so it’s lovely to soak the project in this before blocking. Great to wash all woollies. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Eucalan, meine erste Wahl für Wolle und andere Stoffe
reviews.reviewText: Das Waschmittel ist als unparfümierte Variante erhältlich, man muss die Wäsche nicht spülen und es beinhaltet Lanolin (rückfettend für Wolle). Diese Kombination macht das Eucalan gegenwärtig im Jahr 2022 zu meinem Lieblings Waschmittel für Wolle. Aber auch für andere Stoffe.Und einzigartig auf dem Weltmarkt (unparfümiert, Lanolin, kein Spülen nötig).Chlormethylisothiazolinon wird hier in einer Rezension negativ bewertet.Ich habe Eucalan direkt angeschrieben und mir wurde von Lisa Ward mitgeteilt, dass in den vergangenen 30 Jahren, so lange gibt es das Eucalan Waschmittel schon, es keine Vorfälle durch Chlormethylisothiazolinon gab.Zitat der Antwort von Lisa Ward:For over 30 years we have not heard of any issues with Methylchloroisothiazolinone. I feel it just depends on the individual themselves. We do have customers that prefer to rinse Eucalan and that is okay. We suggest that as you are rinsing it that you add just a little Eucalan to the rinse water to help continue the fibres with the lanolin.Auf der Homepage von Eucalan gibt es vielfältige Anwendungsbeispiele für Eucalan, nicht nur für Wolle.(Fleckenbehandlung für Sofa, Haustiere werden damit gewaschen, Sportkleidung -> allerdings würde ich bei Sportkleidung auf das Spülen nicht verzichten)Ich habe damit meine Levis Jeans mit Flecken gewaschen. Die Flecken waren schon lange auf der Hose, ich wasche meine Jeans ganz selten.Die Flecken habe ich vor dem Waschen mit Wasser benetzt, das Eucalan unverdünnt einmassiert und nach 10 Minuten in eine Schale mit Wasser und Eucalan gelegt. Die Hose wurde hin und wieder innerhalb der zwei Stunden, wo sie sich in der Schale befand gewendet und bewegt. Danach zum Trocknen über Nacht nach draußen auf die Wäscheleine gehängt. Und war schließlich sauber geworden.Bei Anwendung für Wolle habe ich mit Eucalan beste Ergebnisse erzielt, im Vergleich zu anderen Waschmitteln für Wolle. Das Lanolin macht die Wolle weicher als Wollwaschmittel ohne Lanolin.Die Möglichkeit nicht Spülen zu müssen ist gerade in der heutigen Zeit, wo bedacht auf die Umwelt geachtet wird fantastisch!Ich kann allerdings hier auf Amazon seit 2019 das unparfümierte Eucalan nicht kaufen ... Es ist immer ausverkauft. Ich kaufe es über einen Onlineshop.Nachtrag13. Oktober 2023:Habe auf der Eucalan Seite bei FAQ folgende Information zu Methylchloroisothiazolinone gefunden:Methylchloroisothiazolinone (CMIT) is a widely used preservative and antibacterial found in liquid cosmetics, household cleaners, and personal care products.The use of Methylchloroisothiazolinone (Chlormethylisothiazolinon) is regulated in most countries to ensure safe concentrations.As most preservatives are, Methylchloroisothiazolinone can cause skin irritation in high concentrations. However, Eucalan uses the minuscule amount of <10 parts per million (ppm).Methylchloroisothiazolinone is not listed by The International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) as a known, probable, or possible human carcinogen.Das heißt, dass das Chlormethylisothiazolinon der Inhaltsstoff in Eucalan, der hier in einer Rezension negativ bewertet wird in der angewendeten Konzentration harmlos ist.Ich habe so ziemlich alle bekannten Wollwaschmittel in den vergangenen vier Jahren ausprobiert.Ich kann für meine Zwecke sagen, dass Eucalan die Nummer Eins ist.Der Vorteil nicht spülen zu müssen ist unschlagbar und die Wollkleidung durch den Lanolin Anteil fühlbar weich. Der Weichheitseffekt hält etwa fünf Tage an, bei Wollkleidung, die als erste Kleidungsschicht getragen wird. Aber nach fünf Tagen ist auch das Kleidungsstück, welches als erste Kleidungsschicht getragen wird, reif für eine neue Wäsche.
